organization.fullName: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

identificationModule.briefTitle: Johns Hopkins Breast Cancer Program Longitudinal Repository
identificationModule.officialTitle: Johns Hopkins Breast Cancer Program Longitudinal Repository

leadSponsor.name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

collaborators.name: Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Foundation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The Breast Cancer Program Longitudinal Repository (BCPLR) is being established to fulfill the research mission of the Breast Cancer Program at Johns Hopkins and to serve investigators affiliated with it - to develop a repository of specimens with corresponding characteristics from patients seen in the breast care and cancer clinics.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This research is being done to collect samples for future use that we may learn more about cancer by studying cells in blood and tissue collected from people with breast cancer as well as from volunteers without breast cancer. Our goal is to make these available for research to help to learn how cancer develops and how it may be treated.

bioSpec.description: Blood for example: whole blood, serum, plasma, urine, and tissue samples.

armGroups.label: Breast cancer patients
armGroups.description: Participants have a known diagnosis of breast cancer and are receiving a breast cancer evaluation and/or treatment, who agree to sample collection, access, and follow-up as part of the repository.

armGroups.label: Benign breast disease
armGroups.description: Participants have benign breast disease and are receiving a diagnostic procedure and/or evaluation, who agree to sample collection, access, and follow-up as part of the repository.

armGroups.label: Healthy volunteer
armGroups.description: Participants have no known diagnosis of breast disease or abnormality and are undergoing routine screening or diagnostic breast imaging procedures and/or other clinical evaluation, who agree to sample collection, access, and follow-up as part of the repository.

interventions.name: Sample collection
interventions.description: Blood, tissue, urine, and other samples may be collected

primaryOutcomes.description: To develop a repository of specimens with corresponding characteristics - demographic and clinical information - from patients seen in the breast care and cancer clinics

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or female
* 18 years of age or older
* Participants meet one of the following categories: have a known diagnosis of breast cancer receiving a breast cancer evaluation and/or treatment; have benign breast disease receiving a diagnostic procedure and/or evaluation; or, have no known diagnosis of breast disease or abnormality and is undergoing routine screening or diagnostic breast imaging procedures and/or other clinical evaluation.

Exclusion Criteria:

* N/A
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Any man or woman being seen at Johns Hopkins for breast cancer treatment, or for any screening or diagnostic breast procedures (for example: mammograms or biopsies), may join. Individuals without a history of breast cancer, known as "healthy" or "normal" volunteers (meaning they do not have breast cancer) may also join.

overallOfficials.name: Antonio C. Wolff, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

locations.facility: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins
